translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Buddha Chapter

analyzed: añña asi koṇḍa añña tthera apadāna
translated: The Elder Aññāsikoṇḍañña’s Birth Story
“I first saw the Padumuttara Buddha,
the world’s chief, the leader,

analyzed: buddha bhūmim anuppatta  paṭhamam addasam aha
translated: who had attained the Buddha-state,

analyzed: yāvatā bodhiyā mūle  yakkhā sabbe samāgatā
translated: at the foot of the Bodhi tree.🔽All the spirits who had gathered
surrounded the Sambuddha
and paid homage with hands raised in reverence.
All the gods were delighted
and moved about in the sky,
(saying): “The Buddha has appeared,
dispelling the darkness of ignorance.”
A great shout went up
from those who were delighted,
(saying): “In the teaching of the Fully Enlightened One🔽we will burn up the defilements.”

analyzed: devānam giram aññāya  vācā asabhimudīḥ iha
translated: Understanding the gods’ words,🔽I, the chief in speech, spoke thus:
With a delighted mind,
I gave the first alms.
Understanding my thought,
the unsurpassed Teacher in the world,
sitting in the assembly of gods,
recited these verses:
“Seven days after leaving home,🔽I went to the Bodhi tree.
This is my first meal,
the sustenance for one of pure living.”
Having come here from the Tusita heaven,
who brought me alms,
I will proclaim it,
listen to my words.
For twenty-one thousand eons,
he will reign as king of the gods;
Having overcome all the gods,
he will dwell in the Heaven of the Thirty-three.
Having passed away from the world of the gods,
he will go to the human state;
A thousand times a wheel-turning monarch,
he will rule there.
In a hundred thousand eons,
born in the family of the crows,
with the clan name Gotama,
he will be a teacher in the world.
Having passed away from the Heaven of the Thirty-three,
he will go to the human state;
Having gone forth from the home life,
he will dwell for six years.
‘Then in the seventh year,
the Buddha will speak the truth;
One named Koṇḍañña,
will be the first to understand.’
I went forth after he had gone forth,
I practiced the spiritual life well;
For the purpose of burning up the defilements,
I went forth into homelessness.
Having gone to the all-knowing one,
the Buddha in the world with its gods;
In the Isigiri forest,
he beat the drum of the deathless.
Now I have attained the Deathless,
the unsurpassed state of peace;
Having fully understood all the pollutants,
I live without pollutants.
The four discriminations,
and the eight liberations,
The six direct knowledges have been realized;

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā aññāsikoṇḍañño thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmai aññāsikoṇḍaññaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: The Buddha’s instruction has been accomplished.”🔽Thus have I heard: On one occasion the Venerable Aññāsikoṇḍañña recited these verses.
The Venerable Aññāsikoṇḍañña’s Thread is finished.
